Title: Fresh Graduate - Transfer Pricing - HCMC Office
Location: Bitexco Financial Tower, Bến Nghé, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, Bitexco Financial Tower, 28th Floor, 2 Hai Trieu street, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City & 8th Floor, Corner Stone Building, 16 Phan Chu Trinh, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi
Job Description:
Our tax practice revolves around helping our clients effectively manage their tax obligations proactively and responsibly.

As part of a global team of 35,000 tax professionals in 150 countries, you will advise clients on planning, compliance and reporting wherever the client has needs. Our unwavering commitment to quality service and our technical networks enable you to help clients reduce inefficiencies, mitigate risk and improve opportunities within their tax functions. Groups (or, as we call them – sub-service lines) within Tax include Business Tax Services, Global Compliance and Reporting, People Advisory Services, Indirect Tax Services, International Tax Services, Transfer Pricing Services and Transaction Tax Services.

With so many offerings, you have the opportunity to develop your career through a broad scope of engagements, mentoring and formal learning. That’s how we develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders, and in so doing, play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.

We are looking for high performing candidates to join our HCMC Transfer pricing team as Senior consultants and/or experienced staffs.

Major Responsibilities
• Work closely with Managers and team members to deliver transfer pricing/ tax related work to multinational companies across a range of industries
• Attend meetings/interviews for data-gathering and understanding the multinational companies’ business models and their Group’s tax /transfer pricing policies
• Perform supply chain and related industry analyses
• Perform financial and economic analyses
• Assist in drafting transfer pricing compliance reports and information disclosures as part of corporate income tax returns
• Assist in drafting transfer pricing planning and advisory reports
• Participate in transfer pricing/ tax audit assistance
• Be willing to learn and demonstrate a positive attitude towards constructive feedback for future career development
Job Requirements:
Requirements
• Relevant tertiary qualification (e.g. Accounting, Finance, Economics, Commerce, Business, Law, etc.)
• Fresh graduate of less than 1 year of experience in transfer pricing in a professional services/corporate environment
• Strong business acumen
• Exceptional writing and analytical skills
• Sound computer literacy (MS Excel, Word and Power Point essential)
• Ability to manage competing priorities
• Excellent written and spoken Vietnamese and English

Title: Nhân Viên Vận Hành
Company: Công Ty TNHH Khí Công Nghiệp Messer Việt Nam
Location: Thôn Tân Hy, Bình Đông, Bình Sơn, Quảng Ngãi, Việt Nam, Tòa nhà MB, số 6 lô 30A Lê Hồng Phong, Lạc Viên, Ngô Quyền, Hải Phòng
Job Description:
1. Làm việc theo ca liên tục hiệu quả theo đặc điểm kỹ thuật của nhà máy.
2. Liên tục giám sát hoạt động các tham số của dây chuyền, sửa chữa các sự cố trong thời gian hoạt động sản xuất và thực hiện các báo cáo.
3. Tham gia các công việc sửa chữa và bảo trì trong quá trình đại tu, thực hiện kiểm tra vệ sinh máy móc theo định kỳ.
4. Báo cáo tình hình của hệ thống cho trưởng ca
5. Thực hiện những công việc khác theo yêu cầu của giám đốc nhà máy
6. Vệ sinh khu vực thiết bị được giao
Job Requirements:
1. Tốt nghiệp đại học - cao đẳng chuyên ngành kỹ thuật, cơ khí, điện, hóa
2. Ưu tiên có kinh nghiệm trong ngành khí
3. Ưu tiên Tiếng Anh đọc hiểu cơ bản
**Quyền lợi:
- Thưởng 3-4 tháng lương/năm
- Tham gia đủ BHXH, BHYT, BHTN theo luật quy định
- Bảo hiểm sức khỏe 24/7 cho nhân viên
- Cơ hội thăng tiến
- Cơ hội tham gia các khóa đào tạo phát triển bản thân và công việc
- Môi trường làm việc chuyên nghiệp
- Được tham gia các sự kiện, teambuilding do công ty tổ chức

Title: (Experienced Staff) Senior - Valuation, Modeling & Economics Services - HCMC Office
Location: Bitexco Financial Tower, Bến Nghé, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, Bitexco Financial Tower, 28th Floor, 2 Hai Trieu street, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City & 8th Floor, Corner Stone Building, 16 Phan Chu Trinh, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi
Job Description:
The opportunity

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

Our Strategy and Transactions (SaT) team works with clients to manage their capital agenda to drive competitive advantage and increased returns. As part of a global team of 10,000 professionals in 100 countries you will advise clients on preserving, optimising, raising or investing capital.

Strategy and Transactions – Valuation, Modeling and Economics (HCMC Office)

*Your key responsibilities

- Perform the analysis of historical financial performance and financial position in the business valuation for various purposes (e.g. M&A purpose, tax purpose, financial reporting purpose, purchase price allocation, etc.);
- Perform the economy analysis;
- Perform the research of comparable companies and comparable transactions which are used as inputs of market-approach valuation;
- Assist the audit team to review the valuation reports prepared by other valuers (e.g. property valuation reports, Purchase price allocation report, goodwill impairment review, etc.) as an audit procedure;
- Mentor and guide junior staff in valuation techniques and best practices.

*What we offer

Join our SaT team and provide clients a full range of hands-on, operationally focused support and advice across the transaction life cycle, supporting both buyers and sellers. We cover a wide range of operational aspects, including carve-out readiness and support, operational due diligence and restructuring, synergy assessment and delivery, day-one readiness assessment, and 100-day planning, supporting the integration process, integration and assessments of carve-out/stand-alone costs and risks.

- Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
- Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
- Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
- Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

EY | Building a better working world

Title: (Experienced Staff) Senior Consultant - Mergers & Acquisition (M&A) Advisory
Location: Bitexco Financial Tower, Bến Nghé, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, Bitexco Financial Tower, 28th Floor, 2 Hai Trieu street, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City & 8th Floor, Corner Stone Building, 16 Phan Chu Trinh, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi
Job Description:
About The Team

The Mergers and Acquisitions (M&A) Team specializes in providing M&A advisory services for a wide range of buy-side and sell-side transactions. We excel in structuring and executing complex domestic and international acquisitions, divestitures, mergers, joint ventures and other strategic transactions. Collaborating closely with clients, our team develops comprehensive M&A strategies, conducts valuation analysis, negotiates deals, and ensures successful transaction outcomes. We are dedicated to delivering exceptional M&A advisory services to our clients, supporting their growth and strategic objectives.

About the Role

As a Senior Consultant, you will be an integral part of our M&A team, working on strategic assignments involving M&A and other capital market activities. You will have the opportunity to collaborate closely with senior-level decision makers at leading corporations, contributing to the success of our client’s growth strategies.

Key Responsibilities

- Handle multiple M&A projects, focusing on the execution of the transactions and business development

- Draft marketing materials (i.e. teasers, information memoranda, management presentations) and potential pitch decks

- Assist in building financial modeling and valuation exercises for current and potential clients

- Assist in the full transaction execution process, co-ordination of due diligence phases and often act as the main contact person

- Actively participate in external meetings

- Supervise and coach Assistants, help them enhance their contribution and develop their capabilities

- Contribute to EY Strategy and Transactions team and local EY practice
Job Requirements:
To qualify, you must have:

- Bachelor/Master degree ideally in a finance, business administration or related specialization

- Having professional qualifications such as CPA, CFA, ACCA is a plus

- At least 3-5 years' experience in M&A or Corporate Finance environments, including experience playing a key role in executing transactions

- Strong communication, presentation and project management skills

- Proven ability to produce high quality and impactful professional documents for clients and internal use

- Advanced business writing and verbal communication skills in English

Title: Data Processing (Chuyên Viên Xử Lý Dữ Liệu)
Location: 7th & 8th floors, SUCED Tower, 108 Nguyen Hoang street, Tu Liem dist., Hanoi, Vietnam., 108 Nguyen Hoang, Tu Liem, Hanoi
Job Description:
This position is designed for a smart, analytical individual with advanced Excel skills who is eager to develop a long-term career in data management, reporting standardization, and process improvement.
The employee will start by working with Accounting team to understand the company’s data and workflow, then fulltime under HR team to develop and standardize company-wide data analytics and reporting systems.


Phase 1 (First 6 months – Accounting Team):
• Process data and perform financial analysis using Excel.
• Optimize and automate spreadsheets and templates to support accounting operations.
• Gain a deep understanding of the accounting data structure, as well as the factory’s production and operational processes.
Phase 2 (After the first 6 months – HR Team):
• Standardize and upgrade internal templates and reporting formats for HR, Admin, and Accounting.
• Design and maintain interactive dashboards and reporting systems using advanced Excel tools (Pivot Table, Power Query, VBA, etc.).
• Improve payroll templates, processes and reports.
• Provide internal training and guidance on Excel tools and reporting usage.
• Collaborate with HR/IT teams to develop digital reporting and monitoring systems.
• Other jobs within HR & Admin functions as assigned time to time.
Job Requirements:
• University graduate (major not restricted).
• Excellent command of Microsoft Excel (Pivot, Xlookup/Vlookup, Index/Match, Conditional Formatting, Power Query, VBA advantage).
• Strong analytical thinking, data visualization, and logical presentation skills.
• Good communication in English (both written and verbal).
• Smart, proactive, detail-oriented, and passionate about improving processes and efficiency.

Title: Assistant Manager, Environmental Improvement Program
Location: Ho Chi Minh, Room no. 8.6, Floor 8th, Le Meridien Building, 3C Ton Duc Thang Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Job Description:
Key responsibilities
• Lead the engagement and collaboration with suppliers to develop and implement decarbonization and environmental improvement strategies and measure progress toward targets.
• Assess supplier environmental footprints (carbon, energy, waste, water) and support the development of performance improvement plans. Experience in wastewater improvement initiatives is considered an advantage.
• Identify operational gaps and co-develop practical solutions with suppliers.
• Conduct site visits, workshops, and technical support sessions to build supplier capabilities.
• Partner with procurement, group sustainability team (ESG), and operational teams to ensure supplier alignment with corporate sustainability policies and standards.
• Provide feedback and insights to internal teams on supplier performance and challenges.
• Contribute to internal dashboards and progress reports.
• Support audits, sustainability reviews, and reporting cycles tied to supplier performance and climate action.
• Monitor emerging regulations and corporate commitments relevant to supplier environmental performance, assisting suppliers in achieving compliance.
Job Requirements:
Requirements
• Bachelor’s degree on Environmental Science, Sustainability, Supply Chain Management, or related field.
• Professional certifications in environmental management, carbon accounting, or supply chain sustainability preferred.
• 5+ years relevant experience, preferably within sustainability, supply chain, or supplier management.
• Proven track record in driving supplier engagement on climate actions, decarbonization, or environmental impact projects.
• Experience in manufacturing or large-scale procurement business environment preferred.
• Able to collect and evaluate supplier environmental metrics (e.g. carbon emissions, water use, wastes..etc) and identify performance improvement gaps.
• Able to translate data insights into actionable recommendations for environmental improvements.
• Strong understanding of carbon accounting (including scope 1, 2, & 3 emissions).
• Excellent communication, negotiation, and partnership skills with suppliers.
• Analytical skills for data management and performance tracking.
• ~30% local & international travel
• Fluent in English

Title: Trưởng Ban Phát Triển Dự Án Năng Lượng
Location: 51 Xuân Diệu, Tây Hồ, Hà Nội, Tòa nhà Hà Nội Aqua Central, 44 Yên Phụ, Phường Trúc Bạch, Quận Ba Đình, TP Hà Nội
Job Description:
- Chủ trì Lập kế hoạch tổng thể và chi tiết cho các dự án năng lượng từ giai đoạn nghiên cứu, chuẩn bị đầu tư đến khi sẵn sàng thi công.
- Nghiên cứu và đề xuất các cơ hội đầu tư, phát triển dự án năng lượng mới phù hợp với định hướng chiến lược của công ty.
- Tổ chức khảo sát, thu thập dữ liệu (địa điểm, quy hoạch, tài nguyên, hạ tầng) để đánh giá tính khả thi của dự án.
- Xây dựng, quản lý và theo dõi timeline phát triển dự án, đảm bảo đúng tiến độ được phê duyệt.
- Chủ trì chuẩn bị và nộp hồ sơ xin chủ trương đầu tư, chấp thuận địa điểm, đánh giá tác động môi trường (ĐTM), thỏa thuận đấu nối, giấy phép xây dựng, PPA…
- Làm việc với các cơ quan quản lý nhà nước, EVN, chính quyền địa phương và các bên liên quan để hoàn tất thủ tục pháp lý.
- Kiểm soát và thẩm định tính chính xác, đầy đủ của các tài liệu, hồ sơ pháp lý dự án.
- Đại diện công ty làm việc với cơ quan quản lý, nhà đầu tư, đối tác, nhà thầu và tư vấn trong quá trình phát triển dự án.
- Tham gia đàm phán, thương thảo các hợp đồng liên quan đến phát triển dự án.
- Xây dựng và duy trì quan hệ tốt với chính quyền địa phương, EVN và các đối tác chiến lược.
Job Requirements:
1. Tốt nghiệp Đại học trở lên chuyên ngành: Điện, Năng lượng, Quản lý dự án, Luật, Kinh tế hoặc các ngành liên quan.
2. Trên 7 năm kinh nghiệm ở các vị trí tương đương (ưu tiên ứng viên có kinh nghiệm làm việc ở lĩnh vực năng lượng)
3. Am hiểu hệ thống pháp luật Việt Nam về đầu tư, xây dựng, đất đai, môi trường và năng lượng.
4. Có kinh nghiệm làm việc và đàm phán với cơ quan nhà nước, EVN và các đối tác trong/ngoài nước.
5. Ngoại ngữ: Giao tiếp tiếng Anh tốt thành thạo là lợi thế
6. Các kỹ năng khác:
- Kỹ năng quản lý và điều phối dự án, lập kế hoạch và giám sát tiến độ.
- Kỹ năng lãnh đạo và phát triển đội ngũ, giao việc và kiểm soát hiệu quả công việc.
- Kỹ năng làm việc với cơ quan chức năng, soạn thảo và thẩm định hồ sơ pháp lý
- Kỹ năng đàm phán, thương lượng và quản lý quan hệ đối tác (chủ đầu tư, nhà thầu, tư vấn, cơ quan quản lý).

Title: Purchasing Coordinator
Location: BRITISH INTERNATIONAL SCHOOL, HANOI, Lot H3-H4, Hoa Lan Road, Vinhomes Riverside Long Bien, Hanoi
Job Description:
JOB PURPOSE
You’ll help us in sourcing suitable suppliers both locally and internationally; purchasing of a wide range of goods and services, including books, teaching resources, materials, equipment, and supplies for the school; handling all domestic and international travel arrangements, including booking flights, accommodations, and other related logistics.
You’ll co-operate with colleagues in the process and compliance of School’s procurement policies.
As a genuine team-player, you’ll work across our central, regional, and local Purchasing teams to improve purchasing management. Everything we do is connected to our vision to create a generation of resilient and creative global citizens who will change our world for the better.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
PURCHASING
• Procurement & Sourcing: Lead the process of sourcing suitable suppliers, both domestic and international. This includes obtaining and analyzing quotations, conducting price comparisons, and recommending suitable vendors.
• Order Management: Manage the end-to-end process for all school orders, including creating, executing, and processing payments. This covers a wide range of goods and services, such as books, online subscription, teaching resources, materials, equipment, and general supplies.
• Logistics & Travel: Handle all school travel arrangements including booking flights, accommodations, and other related logistics. You will also collaborate with taxi companies to manage our corporate accounts, which involves opening and closing accounts/cards as needed. Your responsibilities will include receiving and reconciling monthly usage statements, followed by creating purchase orders and processing payments to ensure timely and accurate billing.
• System & Records Management: Maintain a comprehensive and accurate database of all purchase orders and records.
• Project & Tender Support: Provide support to the Purchasing Manager and Business Director for tendering and procurement tasks related to renovation, refurbishment, and new projects.
• Collaboration: Work with the Heads of Campus and teachers to compile annual orders for teaching resources, equipment, books and online subscriptions. You will also collaborate with the Accounts Payable team regarding payments to vendors.
OTHER
• Liaise with Account payable regarding payment to vendors / staff’s salary deduction in some cases of air ticket booking.
• Save and prepare all reports related to inchared works for audit purpose when needed.
• Perform other duties assigned by Line manager/ Business Director/ Principal.

This role may take on the additional responsibilities of a Trip Coordinator when required.
Job Requirements:
• Bachelor’s Degree or equivalence.
• Good numeracy and budgeting skills.
• Planning and organisational skills.
• Good negotiation and communication skills.
• Have good English skills in writing and speaking.
• Strong proficiency with Microsoft Word and PowerPoint for producing reports and presentations.
• Good cross-cultural, interpersonal and communication skills to interact with diverse nationalities and cultures.
• Excellent analytical skills – with the passion and drive to demonstrate and quantify success.
• Results orientated with the ability to consistently map efforts against identified KPIs.
• Excellent time management skills and flexibility in dealing with multi-functional tasks.
• You’d like to work in a purpose-led sector.

Skills: Logistics, Negotiation Skills, Order Management, Procurement, Team Work

An exciting opportunity exists for a mid-career lawyer, qualified in Vietnam. The successful candidate will support our team on advising international and local clients on a broad range of corporate and commercial transactions. Familiarity of work with typical cross-border transaction documentation, including SPAs, SHAs, Loan Agreements (including those following APLMA/LMA forms) is required.

Experience of working with LMA/APLMA documentation and cross-border SPAs and Shareholders Agreements would be very useful.
